str2: And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.
Behind, after; back, backwards. From the same as opisthen with enclitic of direction; to the back, i.e. Aback.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
The foot. A primary word; a 'foot'.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: To weep, weep for, mourn, lament. Of uncertain affinity; to sob, i.e. Wail aloud.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To begin. Middle voice of archo; to commence.
To moisten, rain, send rain. A primary verb; to moisten.

The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

A tear. Or dakruon dak'-roo-on; of uncertain affinity; a tear.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To wipe, wipe (off) thoroughly. From ek and the base of massaomai; to knead out, i.e. to wipe dry.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Hair (of the head or of animals). Genitive case trichos, etc. of uncertain derivation; hair.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To kiss affectionately. From kata and phileo; to kiss earnestly.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To anoint: festivally, in homage, medicinally, or in anointing the dead. To oil.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Anointing-oil, ointment. Probably of foreign origin; 'myrrh', i.e. perfumed oil.
